reviewText: Please, Please No. - Seriously, No.\n\nThis game is terrible (such so that I have it in a folder named Terrible" for which is was the first game to be placed into). Its an amazing game in concept that I would love to give the chance to be great...if it could manage to do that. Its a piece of garbage that is thrown together into a contraption that just barely manages to reach its goal (oh wow
date: I totally just explained the entirety of the gameplay)\n\nIs it a cool idea
recommended: yes. Is it a fun game
hoursPlayed: ...hard to say because its basically unplayable. Several times has this game refused to work...or has done something so ...wrong I can't fix it even with the included time rewind. Imagine Prince of Persia: Sands of Time with its time rewind except instead of being a game mechanic that is cool and awesome its a tool used to make sure that if you break the game you can rewind to when it wasn't broken. Like...you can rewind time...which is ONLY used to fix mistakes either you or the game has made.\n\nThere are some levels I remember playing that I don't know what to do on

reviewText:
The main thing about this game is that you can invent things with wheels, propellers and springs. The problem is that once you've designed a two-wheeled bike with an umbrella, spring and rotablades all round, in some sort of trash-pile mess, you realise that there's very little imagination needed. Glue all parts to the engine and it works. Also, poor, generic level design will have you easily forgetting what level you are on; there's green, there's ice and there's fire. Not that any of these are particularly well done either. The designers just assumed you'd come across the levers that open the doors without giving you any indication where they should be or what they open.

The building is as irritating as the physics are twitchy. The movement off vehicle is slow and you'll often die because he fell in a certain way.

And let's not forget the 'hilarious' banter between Sack and the Doc. Which wouldn't be a problem except that the speech bubble also gets in the way sometimes.


I also had a problem when the game decided to corrupt all my saves at one point. Not something I've seen in a game for a long time. Might be a one off.

On the plus side, you can rewind time to correct any mistakes. You'll be using this a lot. Not because you will fail but because it is easier to rewind than rebuild after being hit by a projectile that came from an enemy outside the screen.

If you want to use your creative mind to solve puzzles (not that there's much puzzling here) try Crayon Physics instead.

reviewText:
Pros:
- Half-cynical humour provided by your bag.
- Fun to fly around once you get the parts to do it.

Cons:
- Physics can be unpredictable.
- You can get locked" in place by the environment.
- If you fall a few feet too far you die.

The back-wind-mechanic is pretty much /unstuck since you will no doubt again and again be wedged between different objects
date: get knocked over by one of your wheels
hoursPlayed: have your vehicle roll of a cliff because you're too slow to go after it...\n\nPutting the vehicle together is a pain as the arm can't quite place them as you'd want - the physics doesn't allow you to place wheels underneath the seat. For short
voteText: the developer solution was that you can theoretically put everything "inside" the seat
helpfulPercent: with just a bit sticking out
votesHelpful: and it will still work.\n\nThe game took about 2 hours for me to beat
votesTotal: and then there was a lot of stubborn-ness in not wanting to rebuild the vehicle
votesFunny:
since it's always a pain.

It had great promise and was enjoyable to some extent (thus why it was finished to the end) but all of the hassling around the physics makes me not able to really recommend the game. Took me a week to beat it since I couldn't stand playing it for too long at a time.

Played "casually"
commentsCount: one level or so at a time or 10 minutes at a time... sure. You can save and quit at any point. Just don't expect an all-over enjoyable experience."

reviewText: To be honest, I despise this game.  I can't complain because I was given this for free so I really didn't waste money, I wasted time.  The is a puzzle game with a great art style.  In the beginning of the game they help you so much, but as soon as you get to level 2 the tips, help, and arrows that point you to the objective are gone.  This frustrated me a lot. Thinking I'm going the correct led me to a death pit. When I am going the right way it takes be 30 mins +.  I don't maybe I'm not good at puzzle games.  Verdict, first 1 hour was great, vibrant colors, characters personality, and creativity glued me to the game until I hated it 5 hours later. This is my opinion and I suggest only buy it if you outstanding at puzzle games and have a lot of patience (you'll die alot).  The game sells for $5, if you are going to buy it, buy it on sale.

reviewText:
So far I like the puzzle aspects of the game but I could do without the hand holding tips and lucky for me thus far before they appeared on the screen I already knew what I was going to do.  As far as the controls using the middle mouse button to flip an object around was annoying to me and hard to use and thus I used the keys assigned on the keyboard.  The graphics to me are not what I want usually in a game but I guess the developers went for that Paper Mario look and still though it just isn't good.

Still I think so far there is enough to like about this game as it is a thinking man's game. So glad Indie developers have come around and become bigger in recent years cuz I don't think EA and other big publishers and game makers would bring us games like this themselves.  Thank goodness for Indie develiopers.

(Please note I got this game in some sort of Indie Bundle as an extra and so did not pay $4.99 like people have to on Steam to get it.  Do I think it is worth $4.99?  I assume it is but I haven't played through it long enough to know how much content there is and thus could get a better idea of what the game should be worth when I do that.)

reviewText: Doc Clock: The Toasted Sandwich of Time champion creativity in its vehicle construction but sadly this “feature” is a gimmick at best. If you are playing this game expecting mind blowing puzzle you are in for a huge surprise; puzzles are easily solved by smashing your vehicle against buttons or walls. The only real challenge this game possesses is the ability to completely infuriate you during creative vehicle construction, the collision problems within the game makes attaching materials to your vehicle way harder than it should. Since the entire game is focused on constructing these monstrous creations, you’d think the developers would actually find a way to make building stuff as perfect as possible. The story is average at best, and the attempt at humor is weak. I didn’t have a single “lol” moment in my entire play through. To be quite frank this game barely passes as an average puzzle plat-former.

reviewText:
The Metascore that is used throughout gives this game 62/100.
Ignore that, make your own decision from playing it, or recommendations.

This games style is very simple. As if someone's drawing book has come to life.
Humorous dialogue (text only, no voices) It is a Physics based puzzle game.
You will encounter obstacles like, a pit of spikes, how to get over it?
Build a Helicopter, from a bath tub, a spring to get you into the air, then an umbrella and propeller to glide gracefully over the gap.

It's good fun. Ive not yet completed it, but it doesn't look like a very long game.
However it I dont think it matters because it could be played through again and again making different styles of inventions each time.

The title is bizzare. And the game overall is plain ol' simple fun.
The music, gets a bit repetitive. So far this is my only complaint.

I rate this game, 7 / 10.
If its cheap, its worth a go.

reviewText:
An OK game, not worth more than some pocket change. You play as a scientist who builds contraptions from parts that you find in each level. The goal of the game is to get from point A to point B in each stage while finding pieces to your time machine and collecting misc. items.

The game mechanics are buggy and broken which prevents enjoying the game. The dialogue between the scientist and his robot sidekick is horrible. Every so often the sidekick will make a comeback hinting how much he wants the scientist to commit suicide. What the heck. This may have been unintentional because the dialogue is just plain terrible and not to mention how annoying it is in game to have to put up with the dialogue balloons when you just want to play the damn game.

Would I want a friend to buy it? No.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I really enjoy this game.  Maybe it's because I'm a nerd and have nothing better to do, but this game has grabbed my attention in surprising ways.  From the quest for toasted sandwiches to Sack's hilariously sarcastic comments, this game is something different and fun, and I love its quirkiness.  If I was a game, I'd probably be this one.  So now that I've said that, you have to get it, or else you're saying I'm not worth five dollars!  Seriously, it's a good buy.

reviewText:
Simple game, you build contraptions to traverse the hazards of time, TIME I say!

I have to admit I liked this game; it seems to be geared toward a more casual crowd. I honestly just made a flying machine and flew over everything. I sort of wish it was a bit longer, I think I got this in a super cheap indie pack.

Down side, there are no guns or explosions, up side, there are toasted sandwiches!
